channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023100236
item.description:
Report X-2023100236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking and removed from sortation, then brought to QA. DescribePack: Both caps were loose. Package had been repacked at station 972, and original hazardous labels were left out. Bottles were packed sideways in the box and leaking from the caps. SPIDR images show original packaging had Limited Quantity diamond. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a spill bin and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023090843
item.description:
Report X-2023090843

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PRELOADER WAS LOADING PACKAGE AND HEARD AEROSOL CANS RATTLING IN THE BOX WITH NO MARKINGS. THEY DID NOT OPEN THE BOX, BUT BROUGHT TO PSC FOR INVESTIGATION. RMP OPENED BOX AND DISCOVERED FOUR AEROSOL CANS WITH NO ORIGINAL LABELING DENOTING CONTENTS. RMP CALLED HMSC TO REPORT UNDECLARED SHIPMENT. SUBMITTING PACKAGE INTO ETT FOR REGULATORY COMPLIANCE REVIEW.

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE BUT WHEN OPENED, RESPONDER DISCOVERED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT OF AEROSOL CANS AND DIRECTED THE PACKAGE TO SUPERVISOR.

item.title: Report X-2023090011
item.description:
Report X-2023090011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Aug 21 during the AM sort a box was found to have been leaking. The package contained UN1805, Phosphoric Acid Solution, 8, III. The bottle had been packaged surrounded by cardboard and during transit the bottle broke causing the contents to spill. The package has been placed into a salvage drum and it is being sent out for disposal per the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023081066
item.description:
Report X-2023081066

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ODOT Hazmat Inspector C. Kuenzi identified the SHQX 50612 as leaking vapor in the protective housing during an inspection at the PTRC - Lakeyard. The car was isolated by PTRC employees and BNSF dispatched contract responders to inspect the car. The responders found the vapor valve plug to be less than tool tight, easily moved by hand and the valve to be partially open. The valve was fully closed and the leak was mitigated. The plug was removed, inspected and had teflon tape applied. The car was fully secured and inspected, then released back into transportation. All released LPG dissipated and no clean up was necessary. Estimated release volumes are only based upon a best estimate as observed by responders.
